page.title: 02Landscape
page.content: The landscape is undulating, varying in height from 250 feet at the Wey Brook in Sherborne St. John, to 450 feet near Park Prewett Hospital. The village of Sherborne St. John is in a hollow with a belt of woodland to the north, and higher ground to the south. This chalk scarp divides the village from North Basingstoke. The village open areas are mainly privately owned with the village green and the recreation ground the exceptions. The valley of the Wey Brook forms a notable feature to the north of the village. The extensive grounds of the Hospital are partly landscaped and planted and include a pleasant nine holed golf course. Popley and Oakridge have a few open spaces amongst the high density housing, with play areas for the children.
